newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: NSA buys 24 mln rand Master Fridge stake.
newsitem.headline: NSA buys 24 mln rand Master Fridge stake.

text.p: NSA Investments Ltd has bought an initial nine percent stake in Master Fridge Ltd with immediate effect for 23.9 million rand, the companies said in a joint statement on Wednesday.
The companies were also examining ways in which the stake could be increased to 20 percent by July 1, 1997.

"The initial transaction for a nine percent equity holding involves the issue of 7.5 million Master Fridge shares to NSA for cash of 23.9 million rand at an issue price of 3.20 rand per share," the statement said.

"A further equity stake will be acquired by NSA through the issue of 17.3 million in non-interest bearing debentures by Master Fridge to NSA convertable into 5.4 million Master Fridge shares at a price of 3.20 rand per share on July 1, 1997."
Master Fridge has an estimated 45 percent market share of refrigeration and freezer products in South Africa.
It listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange on April 29 and has five production plants - all located in Swaziland.
The companies said Master Fridge was well positioned for growth in view of electricity utility Eskom's aim to provide electricity to 10,000 new households every month.

NSA said Master Frigde fitted its investment strategy to take significant minority interests in high quality, medium-sized companies with long-term potential to grow earnings above the market average.
Master Fridge executive director Bronwen Phillips said the cash injection would impact positively on bottom line earnings and place it in an even more competitive export position.
"This transaction will help maintain the momentum we have built up over the last few years," she said.
